item.title: Green Hosting Reduces Environmental Issues
item.description: World Environment Day encourages us to consider how we can lessen our environmental footprint. While this often evokes thoughts of making sacrifices, what if there were ways to gain advantages while simultaneously addressing environmental concerns? Wouldn’t that be an appealing approach? Getting more for less is universally desired, and thankfully, we can achieve this by being discerning about the companies we support. Choosing environmentally conscious businesses doesn’t necessarily equate to higher costs; in fact, many responsible companies share the cost savings from their efficient practices with their customers.

item.title: Techâ€™s Moo Poo Buy Plan
item.description: The internet’s increasing energy consumption is rapidly becoming a concern. Data centers, responsible for powering websites and online services, are constantly seeking new energy sources as traditional ones dwindle. Surprisingly, livestock, particularly cows, might be the answer. While it may sound amusing, cow manure possesses the potential to power the internet. Large-scale server farms require substantial energy, and a new approach involves harnessing the bio-energy from animal waste. This process, known as anaerobic digestion, converts manure into biogas, primarily methane, which can then power turbines to generate electricity.
